p: The biochemical analyses of the CSF also include lactate and glucose in addition to the determination of protein. The glucose has to be compared to a plasma glucose which should be taken before the LP [ 10]. For viral-related CNS infections the protein is normal or mildly elevated (<0.95 g/L), the glucose ratio normal or decreased (normal = >0.4â€“0.5), and the lactate normal. Albuminocytologic dissociation (elevated protein and normal CSF cell count) is a strong marker for acute and chronic demyelinating polyneuropathies, but may be detected only after at least 1 week of illness [ 34].
